title: Point 1
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria or to score the response.

To earn this point, responses must demonstrate the following:

  • Accesses* all vehicles in playerList (no bounds errors)

* An enhanced for loop inherently accesses all elements of an ArrayList

Canonical Solution: 

public String playerWithClosestScore(int targetScore)
{
   int minDiff = Math.abs(targetScore - 
                          playerList.get(0).getScore());
   String result = playerList.get(0).getID();
    
   for (Player p : playerList)
   {
      int diff = Math.abs(targetScore – p.getScore());
      if (diff < minDiff)
      {
         minDiff = diff;
         result = p.getID();
      }
   }
   return result;
}

Alternate Canonical:

public String playerWithClosestScore(int targetScore)
{
   int minDiff = Math.abs(targetScore - 
                          playerList.get(0).getScore());
   String result = playerList.get(0).getID();
    
   for (int j = 1; j < playerList.size(); j++)
   {
      int diff = Math.abs(targetScore – 
                          playerList.get(j).getScore());
      if (diff < minDiff)
      {
         minDiff = diff;
         result = playerList.get(j).getID();
      }
   }
   return result;
}
descriptions:
The response does not earn the point.

Responses can still earn the point even if they

  • fail to use the accessed value
  • return early, as long as loop bounds support accessing all elements

Responses will not earn the point if they

  • use an indexed loop with correct bounds but fail to access an item inside the loop
  • access the elements of playerList incorrectly
  • use array syntax to access ArrayList elements ([ ])

The response earns the point.

Responses can still earn the point even if they

  • fail to use the accessed value
  • return early, as long as loop bounds support accessing all elements

Responses will not earn the point if they

  • use an indexed loop with correct bounds but fail to access an item inside the loop
  • access the elements of playerList incorrectly
  • use array syntax to access ArrayList elements ([ ])

title: Point 2
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria or to score the response.

To earn this point, responses must demonstrate the following:

  • Calls getScore on an element from the list

Canonical Solution:

public String playerWithClosestScore(int targetScore)
{
   int minDiff = Math.abs(targetScore - 
                          playerList.get(0).getScore());
   String result = playerList.get(0).getID();
    
   for (Player p : playerList)
   {
      int diff = Math.abs(targetScore – p.getScore());
      if (diff < minDiff)
      {
         minDiff = diff;
         result = p.getID();
      }
   }
   return result;
}

Alternate Canonical:

public String playerWithClosestScore(int targetScore)
{
   int minDiff = Math.abs(targetScore - 
                          playerList.get(0).getScore());
   String result = playerList.get(0).getID();
    
   for (int j = 1; j < playerList.size(); j++)
   {
      int diff = Math.abs(targetScore – 
                          playerList.get(j).getScore());
      if (diff < minDiff)
      {
         minDiff = diff;
         result = playerList.get(j).getID();
      }
   }
   return result;
}
descriptions:
The response does not earn the point.

Responses can still earn the point even if they

  • use array syntax to access ArrayList elements ([ ])
  • have a bounds error
  • fail to call getID

Responses will not earn the point if they

  • ever call a Player method incorrectly

The response earns the point.

Responses can still earn the point even if they

  • use array syntax to access ArrayList elements ([ ])
  • have a bounds error
  • fail to call getID

Responses will not earn the point if they

  • ever call a Player method incorrectly

title: Point 3
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria or to score the response.

To earn this point, responses must demonstrate the following:

  • Compares two values derived from different elements in playerList (body of control flow statement must not be empty)

Canonical Solution: 

public String playerWithClosestScore(int targetScore)
{
   int minDiff = Math.abs(targetScore - 
                          playerList.get(0).getScore());
   String result = playerList.get(0).getID();
    
   for (Player p : playerList)
   {
      int diff = Math.abs(targetScore – p.getScore());
      if (diff < minDiff)
      {
         minDiff = diff;
         result = p.getID();
      }
   }
   return result;
}

Alternate Canonical:

public String playerWithClosestScore(int targetScore)
{
   int minDiff = Math.abs(targetScore - 
                          playerList.get(0).getScore());
   String result = playerList.get(0).getID();
    
   for (int j = 1; j < playerList.size(); j++)
   {
      int diff = Math.abs(targetScore – 
                          playerList.get(j).getScore());
      if (diff < minDiff)
      {
         minDiff = diff;
         result = playerList.get(j).getID();
      }
   }
   return result;
}
descriptions:
The response does not earn the point.

Responses can still earn the point even if they

  • access Player or ArrayList incorrectly
  • call getScore incorrectly
  • calculate an incorrect difference
  • use incorrect logic for the condition (e.g., > in place of <)

Responses will not earn the point if they

  • fail to call getScore
  • fail to compare using <, >,  <=, or >=

The response earns the point.

Responses can still earn the point even if they

  • access Player or ArrayList incorrectly
  • call getScore incorrectly
  • calculate an incorrect difference
  • use incorrect logic for the condition (e.g., > in place of <)

Responses will not earn the point if they

  • fail to call getScore
  • fail to compare using <, >,  <=, or >=

title: Point 4
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria or to score the response.

To earn this point, responses must demonstrate the following:

  • Calculates a nonnegative difference between a score and targetScore

Canonical Solution: 

public String playerWithClosestScore(int targetScore)
{
   int minDiff = Math.abs(targetScore - 
                          playerList.get(0).getScore());
   String result = playerList.get(0).getID();
    
   for (Player p : playerList)
   {
      int diff = Math.abs(targetScore – p.getScore());
      if (diff < minDiff)
      {
         minDiff = diff;
         result = p.getID();
      }
   }
   return result;
}

Alternate Canonical:

public String playerWithClosestScore(int targetScore)
{
   int minDiff = Math.abs(targetScore - 
                          playerList.get(0).getScore());
   String result = playerList.get(0).getID();
    
   for (int j = 1; j < playerList.size(); j++)
   {
      int diff = Math.abs(targetScore – 
                          playerList.get(j).getScore());
      if (diff < minDiff)
      {
         minDiff = diff;
         result = playerList.get(j).getID();
      }
   }
   return result;
}
descriptions:
The response does not earn the point.

Responses can still earn the point even if they

  • calculate absolute value without using Math.abs
  • call getScore incorrectly
  • have an incorrect calculation, as long as there is at least one correct calculation of nonnegative difference

Responses will not earn the point if they

  • fail to call getScore
  • fail to compare player scores to targetScore

The response earns the point.

Responses can still earn the point even if they

  • calculate absolute value without using Math.abs
  • call getScore incorrectly
  • have an incorrect calculation, as long as there is at least one correct calculation of nonnegative difference

Responses will not earn the point if they

  • fail to call getScore
  • fail to compare player scores to targetScore

title: Point 5
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria or to score the response.

To earn this point, responses must demonstrate the following:

  • Returns ID of player with score closest to the target score (algorithm)

Canonical Solution: 

public String playerWithClosestScore(int targetScore)
{
   int minDiff = Math.abs(targetScore - 
                          playerList.get(0).getScore());
   String result = playerList.get(0).getID();
    
   for (Player p : playerList)
   {
      int diff = Math.abs(targetScore – p.getScore());
      if (diff < minDiff)
      {
         minDiff = diff;
         result = p.getID();
      }
   }
   return result;
}

Alternate Canonical:

public String playerWithClosestScore(int targetScore)
{
   int minDiff = Math.abs(targetScore - 
                          playerList.get(0).getScore());
   String result = playerList.get(0).getID();
    
   for (int j = 1; j < playerList.size(); j++)
   {
      int diff = Math.abs(targetScore – 
                          playerList.get(j).getScore());
      if (diff < minDiff)
      {
         minDiff = diff;
         result = playerList.get(j).getID();
      }
   }
   return result;
}
descriptions:
The response does not earn the point.

Responses can still earn the point even if they

  • call Player or ArrayList methods incorrectly
  • use array syntax to access ArrayList elements ([ ])
  • have a bounds error
  • determine player with closest score based on incorrect nonnegative difference

Responses will not earn the point if they

  • initialize or update the best-so-far variable(s) incorrectly
  • fail to call getID
  • fail to consider the target score
  • use incorrect logic for the condition (e.g., > in place of <)
  • fail to return the identified player ID
  • return early
  • modify playerList

The response earns the point.

Responses can still earn the point even if they

  • call Player or ArrayList methods incorrectly
  • use array syntax to access ArrayList elements ([ ])
  • have a bounds error
  • determine player with closest score based on incorrect nonnegative difference

Responses will not earn the point if they

  • initialize or update the best-so-far variable(s) incorrectly
  • fail to call getID
  • fail to consider the target score
  • use incorrect logic for the condition (e.g., > in place of <)
  • fail to return the identified player ID
  • return early
  • modify playerList
